title: Pride and Prejudice
description: A romantic novel by Jane Austen that explores manners and matrimonial machinations.

title: Moby-Dick
description: Herman Melville's epic tale of obsession and the sea.

title: War and Peace
description: Leo Tolstoy's sweeping epic of Russian society during the Napoleonic era.

title: Crime and Punishment
description: Fyodor Dostoevsky's psychological drama of guilt and redemption.

title: The Brothers Karamazov
description: A deep philosophical novel about morality, faith, and family.

title: Great Expectations
description: Charles Dickens' story of growth, ambition, and self-discovery.

title: Jane Eyre
description: Charlotte Brontë's tale of a governess finding independence and love.

title: Wuthering Heights
description: A tragic romance by Emily Brontë set on the moody moors of Yorkshire.

title: Les Misérables
description: Victor Hugo's tale of justice, love, and revolution in France.

title: The Count of Monte Cristo
description: A gripping tale of betrayal, revenge, and redemption.

title: Anna Karenina
description: Tolstoy’s tragic romance of high society and infidelity.

title: The Picture of Dorian Gray
description: Oscar Wilde’s gothic story of vanity and moral decay.

title: Dracula
description: Bram Stoker’s horror classic about the infamous vampire Count.

title: Frankenstein
description: Mary Shelley's science fiction parable of ambition and consequence.

title: A Tale of Two Cities
description: Dickens’ dramatic narrative of love and revolution.

title: The Scarlet Letter
description: Nathaniel Hawthorne’s exploration of sin, guilt, and redemption.

title: Don Quixote
description: Cervantes’ satirical journey of a deluded would-be knight.

title: The Odyssey
description: Homer’s epic poem of a hero’s long journey home.

title: Madame Bovary
description: Gustave Flaubert’s critique of romantic idealism.

title: The Stranger
description: Albert Camus’ existential exploration of alienation.
